snippet: Newly released documents include lots of black censorship bars and no real clarity on the government’s secret surveillance programs.
abstract: Editorial holds Obama administration's release of narrowly selected and heavily censored documents offers no real clarity on government's secret surveillance programs; contends release and testimony by more officials before Congress were a failed effort to defend legality and value of surveillance of Americans' telephone calls; calls for halting of program until the public gets a satisfactory accounting.
lead_paragraph: Newly released documents include lots of black censorship bars and no real clarity on the government’s secret surveillance programs.

headline.main: More Fog From the Spy Agencies
headline.print_headline: More Fog From the Spy Agencies
